ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking behind while giving teachings to people walking in front. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching while walking behind to someone walking in front who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk71:1.9_0: The eleventh training rule is finished.
